nb.purpose:
For √• registrere detaljer om ett identifisert helseproblem eller en diagnose.

Omfanget for et helseproblem er med vilje l√∏st definert, for √• kunne registrere en reell eller selvoppfattet bekymring som i st√∏rre eller mindre grad kan p√•virke et individs velv√¶re negativt. nb.use:
Brukes til √• registrere detaljer om ett identifisert helseproblem eller en diagnose. 

√Ö klart definere skillet mellom et "problem" og en "diagnose" er i praksis nesten umulig, og vi kan ikke p√• en p√•litelig m√•te si n√•r et problem skal ses p√• som en diagnose. N√•r diagnostiske- eller klassifikasjonskriterier er innfridd kan vi trygt kalle tilstanden en formell diagnose, men f√∏r disse kriteriene er m√∏tt kan det dersom det finnes st√∏ttende funn ogs√• v√¶re riktig √• kalle den en diagnose. Mengden st√∏ttende funn som kreves for √• sette merkelappen "diagnose" er ikke lett √• definere, og varierer sannsynligvis i praksis fra tilstand til tilstand. Mange standardiseringskomiteer har arbeidet med dette definisjonsproblemet i √•revis uten √• komme til noen klar konklusjon.

N√•r det gjelder klinisk dokumentasjon med denne arketypen m√• problemer og diagnoser ses p√• som deler av et spektrum der √∏kende detaljgrad og mengde st√∏ttende funn som regel gir vekt mot merkelappen "diagnose". I denne arketypen er det ikke n√∏dvendig √• klassifisere tilstanden som enten et problem eller en diagnose. Datastrukturen for √• dokumentere dem er identisk, med tilleggsstrukturer som st√∏tter inklusjon av nye funn n√•r eller hvis de blir tilgjengelige. Eksempler p√• problemer kan v√¶re et individs uttrykte √∏nske om √• g√• ned i vekt uten en formell diagnose av fedme, eller problemer i forholdet til et familiemedlem. Eksempler p√• formelle diagnoser kan v√¶re en kreftsvulst der diagnosen er st√∏ttet av historisk informasjon, unders√∏kelsesfunn, histologiske funn, radiologiske funn, og som m√∏ter alle diagnosekriterier. I praksis er de fleste problemer eller diagnoser ikke i hver sin ende av problem/diagnose-spektrumet, men et sted mellom.

Denne arketypen kan brukes i mange sammenhenger. Eksempler kan v√¶re √• registrere et problem eller en klinisk diagnose under en klinisk konsultasjon, fylle en persistent problemliste, eller for √• gi oppsummerende informasjon i en epikrise.

Disse kvalifikatorene kan arketypes separat og inkluderes i "Status"-SLOTet, fordi bruken varierer i ulike settinger. Disse vil sannsynligvis hovedsakelig brukes i passende sammenhenger, og ikke deles utenfor sammenhengen uten en klar forst√•else av mulige konsekvenser. For eksempel kan en hoveddiagnose for en kliniker v√¶re en bidiagnose for en annen spesialist, et aktivt problem kan bli inaktivt (og omvendt), og dette kan ha innvirkning p√• sikkerhet og beslutningsst√∏tte. Generelt burde disse kvalifikatorene brukes lokalt og innenfor kontekst i det kliniske systemet, og i praksis b√∏r de manuelt administreres av klinikere for √• sikre at lister over n√•v√¶rende/tidligere, aktiv/inaktiv eller hoved/bidiagnoser er klinisk presise.

I noen situasjoner antas det at √• stille en diagnose ligger fullstendig innenfor legers domene, men dette er ikke hensikten med denne arketypen. Diagnoser kan registreres av alt helsepersonell ved hjelp av denne arketypen.

es-ar.purpose:
Para el registro de detalles acerca de un √∫nico problema de salud o diagn√≥stico.
El alcance previsto del problema de salud se mantiene deliberadamente poco definido en el contexto de la documentaci√≥n cl√≠nica, de modo tal que pueda representarse cualquier problema, real o percibido, que pueda afectar al bienestar de un individuo en cualquier grado. Un problema de salud puede ser identificado por un individuo, un cuidador, o un profesional de la salud. Para la definici√≥n de un diagn√≥stico se require adem√°s de criterios cl√≠nicos objetivos, habitualmente determinados por un profesional de la salud.
es-ar.use:
Util√≠cese para registrar detalles acerca de un √∫nico problema de salud o diagn√≥stico.

Una definici√≥n clara que permita diferenciar un "problema" de un "diagn√≥stico" es casi imposible en la pr√°ctica - no podemos determinar en forma confiable cuando un problema deber√≠a ser considerado un diagn√≥stico. La cantidad de evidencia de apoyo var√≠a de caso en caso. Muchos comit√©s de est√°ndares han lidiado con este problema por a√±os sin lograr una resoluci√≥n clara.

A los fines de la documentaci√≥n cl√≠nica mediante este arquetipo, problema y diagn√≥stico son considerados como un continuo, donde el incremento de los niveles de detalle y sustento en la evidencia inclinan la balanza hacia la etiqueta de "diagn√≥stico". Los requerimientos de datos que sustentan la documentaci√≥n de ambos son id√©nticos, siendo necesarias estructuras de datos adicionales para sustentar la inclusi√≥n de la evidencia cuando esta exista y se encuentre disponible. Los ejemplos de problemas incluyen: la expresi√≥n del deseo de bajar de peso por parte de un individuo sin la existencia de un diagn√≥stico formal de obesidad, o un problema de relaci√≥n con un familiar. Los ejemplos de diagn√≥sticos formales incluyen un c√°ncer fundamentado en informaci√≥n hist√≥rica, los hallazgos de un examen, los hallazgos histopatol√≥gicos, los hallazgos radiol√≥gicos, y que cumplen todos los criterios diagn√≥sticos. En la pr√°ctica, la mayor√≠a de los problemas o diagn√≥sticos no se encuentran en los extremos del espectro problema-diagn√≥stico sino que se ubican en alguna posici√≥n intermedia.

Este arquetipo puede ser utilizado en diversos contextos. Por ejemplo, para registrar un problema o diagn√≥stico cl√≠nico durante una consulta cl√≠nica, para la elaboraci√≥n de una Lista de Problemas persistente, o para proveer una afirmaci√≥n sumaria dentro de un documento de Resumen de Alta.

En la pr√°ctica, los cl√≠nicos utilizan muchos calificadores dependientes del contexto, tales como pasado/actual, primario/secundario, activo/inactivo, admisi√≥n/egreso, etc. Estos contextos pueden ser relativos a la localizaci√≥n, la especializaci√≥n, el episodio, o a un instancia de un proceso, pudiendo entonces generar confusi√≥n o riesgos potenciales de seguridad para el paciente si son incluidos en Listas de Problemas o documentos compartidos que carecen del contexto original. Estos contextos pueden ser arquetipados en forma separada e incluidos en el slot de "Estado", dado que su uso var√≠a en diferentes escenarios. Su uso mayormente pretendido debe darse en el contexto apropiado y no deber√≠a ser compartido fuera de dicho contexto sin una clara comprensi√≥n de sus consecuencias potenciales. Por ejemplo: un diagn√≥stico primario podr√≠a ser un diagn√≥stico secundario para otro especialista; un problema activo puede tornarse inactivo (o viceversa) e impactar en la seguridad de una decisi√≥n cl√≠nica. En general, estos calificadores deber√≠an aplicarse localmente dentro del contexto del sistema cl√≠nico y en la pr√°ctica estos estados deber√≠an ser manualmente mantenidos por cl√≠nicos a fin de asegurar que las listas de problemas, actuales o pasados, activos o inactivos o primarios y secundarios, sean cl√≠nicamente exactos.

Se requerir√° del desarrollo de arquetipos adicionales para la representaci√≥n de conceptos cl√≠nicos tales como una condici√≥n para un organizador general de diagn√≥sticos, etc.

En algunas situaciones puede asumirse que la identificaci√≥n de un diagn√≥stico solo se ajusta a la experticia del m√©dico, pero no es el prop√≥sito de este arquetipo. Los diagn√≥sticos pueden ser registrados mediante este arquetipo por parte de cualquier profesional.

O escopo pretendido de um problema de sa√∫de √© deliberadamente mantido livre no contexto da documenta√ß√£o cl√≠nica, de forma a captar quaisquer preocupa√ß√µes reais ou percebidas que podem afetar adversamente, em qualquer grau, o bem-estar de um indiv√≠duo. Um problema de sa√∫de pode ser identificado pela o indiv√≠duo, um prestador de cuidados ou de um profissional de sa√∫de. No entanto, o diagn√≥stico √© adicionalmente definido com base em crit√©rios cl√≠nicos objetivos, e, geralmente, determinado apenas por um profissional de sa√∫de.
pt-br.use:
Para gravar detalhes sobre um √∫nico problema de sa√∫de ou diagn√≥stico identificado.

Defini√ß√µes claras que permitem a diferencia√ß√£o entre um "problema" e um "diagn√≥stico" s√£o quase imposs√≠veis na pr√°tica - n√£o podemos dizer de forma segura quando um problema deve ser considerado como um diagn√≥stico. Quando o diagn√≥stico ou os crit√©rios de classifica√ß√£o s√£o cumpridos com sucesso, ent√£o com confian√ßa podemos chamar a condi√ß√£o de um diagn√≥stico formal, mas antes que essas condi√ß√µes sejam cumpridas e enquanto houver evid√™ncias para tanto, tamb√©m pode ser v√°lido usar o termo "diagn√≥stico". A quantidade de evid√™ncias de apoio requerida para a indica√ß√£o de diagn√≥stico n√£o √© f√°cil de ser definida e na realidade, provavelmente varia de condi√ß√£o para condi√ß√£o. Muitos comit√™s de padr√µes t√™m, por anos, se confrontado com esse dilema de defini√ß√£o sem resolu√ß√£o clara. 

Este arqu√©tipo pode ser utilizado em muitos contextos. Por exemplo, na grava√ß√£o de um problema ou um diagn√≥stico durante uma consulta cl√≠nica; preencher uma lista de problema persistente; ou para fornecer uma declara√ß√£o de resumo de um documento Sum√°rio de Alta.

Na pr√°tica, os cl√≠nicos usam muitos qualificadores de contexto espec√≠fico, como passado / presente, prim√°rio / secund√°rio, ativo / inativo, admiss√£o / alta, etc. Os contextos podem ser: localiza√ß√£o, especializa√ß√£o, epis√≥dio ou espec√≠ficos de fluxo de trabalho, e estes podem causar confus√£o ou at√© mesmo potenciais problemas de seguran√ßa se persistido nas listas de problemas ou compartilhados em documentos que est√£o fora do contexto original. Estes qualificadores podem ser arquetipados separadamente e inclu√≠dos no slot 'Estado', porque seu uso varia em diferentes contextos. Espera-se que estes ser√£o utilizados em sua maioria dentro do contexto apropriado e n√£o compartilhados fora desse contexto, sem compreens√£o clara das consequ√™ncias potenciais. Por exemplo, um diagn√≥stico prim√°rio para um cl√≠nico pode ser um secund√°rio para outro especialista; um problema ativo pode se tornar inativo (ou vice-versa) e isso pode impactar no uso seguro do apoio √† decis√£o cl√≠nica. Em geral, estes qualificadores devem ser aplicados localmente dentro do contexto do sistema cl√≠nico e na pr√°tica, esses estados devem ser criados manualmente pelos cl√≠nicos para assegurar que as listas de problemas: Presente / Passado, ativo / inativo ou prim√°rio / secund√°rio s√£o clinicamente precisas.

Este arqu√©tipo ser√° usado como um componente dentro do Registro Cl√≠nico Orientado √† Problemas, tal como descrito por Larry Weed. Arqu√©tipos adicionais, que representam conceitos cl√≠nicos, tais como: condi√ß√£o como um organizador abrangente para diagn√≥sticos etc, ter√£o de ser desenvolvidos para apoiar esta abordagem.

Em algumas situa√ß√µes, pode ser assumido que a identifica√ß√£o de um diagn√≥stico s√≥ se encaixa dentro da expertise do m√©dico, mas esta n√£o √© a inten√ß√£o para este arqu√©tipo. Os diagn√≥sticos podem ser gravados utilizando esse arqu√©tipo por qualquer profissional de sa√∫de.
pt-br.misuse:
N√£o deve ser usado para registrar os sintomas descritos pelo indiv√≠duo, para isso, use o arqu√©tipo CLUSTER.symptom, geralmente dentro do arqu√©tipo OBSERVATION.story.

N√£o deve ser usado para registrar achados do exame, use o CLUSTER da fam√≠lia de arqu√©tipos relacionadas ao exame, geralmente aninhados dentro do arqu√©tipo OBSERVATION.exam.

N√£o deve ser usado para gravar 'diagn√≥sticos diferenciais', use o arqu√©tipo EVALUATION.differential_diagnosis.

N√£o deve ser usado para gravar declara√ß√µes sobre rea√ß√µes adversas, alergias ou intoler√¢ncias, use o arqu√©tipo EVALUATION.adverse_reaction.

N√£o deve ser usado para a grava√ß√£o de uma aus√™ncia expl√≠cita (ou presen√ßa negativa) de um problema ou diagn√≥stico, por exemplo: "sem problema ou diagn√≥sticos conhecido" ou "diabetes n√£o conhecido". en.purpose:
For recording details about a single, identified health problem or diagnosis. 

The intended scope of a health problem is deliberately kept loose in the context of clinical documentation, so as to capture any real or perceived concerns that may adversely affect an individual's wellbeing to any degree. A health problem may be identified by the individual, a carer or a healthcare professional. However, a diagnosis is additionally defined based on objective clinical criteria, and usually determined only by a healthcare professional.
en.use:
Use for recording details about a single, identified health problem or diagnosis. 

Clear definitions that enable differentiation between a 'problem' and a 'diagnosis' are almost impossible in practice - we cannot reliably tell when a problem should be regarded as a diagnosis. When diagnostic or classification criteria are successfully met, then we can confidently call the condition a formal diagnosis, but prior to these conditions being met and while there is supportive evidence available, it can also be valid to use the term 'diagnosis'. The amount of supportive evidence required for the label of diagnosis is not easy to define and in reality probably varies from condition to condition. Many standards committees have grappled with this definitional conundrum for years without clear resolution.

For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'. In this archetype it is not neccessary to classify the condition as a 'problem' or 'diagnosis'. The data requirements to support documentation of either are identical, with additional data structure required to support inclusion of the evidence if and when it becomes available. Examples of problems include: the individual's expressed desire to lose weight, but without a formal diagnosis of Obesity; or a relationship problem with a family member. Examples of formal diagnoses would include a cancer that is supported by historical information, examination findings, histopathological findings, radiological findings and meets all requirements for known diagnostic criteria. In practice, most problems or diagnoses do not sit at either end of the problem-diagnosis spectrum, but somewhere in between.

This archetype can be used within many contexts. For example, recording a problem or a clinical diagnosis during a clinical consultation; populating a persistent Problem List; or to provide a summary statement within a Discharge Summary document.

In practice, clinicians use many context-specific qualifiers such as past/present, primary/secondary, active/inactive, admission/discharge etc. The contexts can be location-, specialisation-, episode- or workflow-specific, and these can cause confusion or even potential safety issues if perpetuated in Problem Lists or shared in documents that are outside of the original context. These qualifiers can be archetyped separately and included in the ‚ÄòStatus‚Äô slot, because their use varies in different settings. It is expected that these will be used mostly within the appropriate context and not shared out of that context without clear understanding of potential consequences. For example, a primary diagnosis to one clinician may be a secondary one to another specialist; an active problem can become inactive (or vice versa) and this can impact the safe use of clinical decision support. In general these qualifiers should be applied locally within the context of the clinical system, and in practice these statuses should be manually curated by clinicians to ensure that lists of Current/Past, Active/Inactive or Primary/Secondary Problems are clinically accurate. 

This archetype will be used as a component within the Problem Oriented Medical Record as described by Larry Weed. Additional archetypes, representing clinical concepts such as condition as an overarching organiser for diagnoses etc, will need to be developed to support this approach.

In some situations, it may be assumed that identification of a diagnosis fits only within the expertise of physicians, but this is not the intent for this archetype. Diagnoses can be recorded using this archetype by any healthcare professional.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record symptoms as described by the individual - use the CLUSTER.symptom archetype, usually within the OBSERVATION.story archetype.

Not to be used to record examination findings - use the family of examination-related CLUSTER archetypes, usually nested within the OBSERVATION.exam archetype.

Not to be used to record laboratory test results or related diagnoses, for example pathological diagnoses - use an appropriate archetype from the laboratory family of OBSERVATION archetypes.

Not to be used to record imaging examination results or imaging diagnoses - use an appropriate archetype from the imaging family of OBSERVATION archetypes.

Not to be used to record 'Differential Diagnoses' - use the EVALUATION.differential_diagnosis archetype.

Not to be used to record 'Reason for Encounter' or 'Presenting Complaint' - use the EVALUATION.reason_for_encounter archetype.

Not to be used to record procedures - use the ACTION.procedure archetype.

Not to be used to record details about pregnancy - use the EVALUATION.pregnancy_bf_status and EVALUATION.pregnancy and related archetypes.

Not to be used to record statements about health risk or potential problems - use the EVALUATION.health_risk archetype.

Not to be used to record statements about adverse reactions, allergies or intolerances - use the EVALUATION.adverse_reaction archetype.

Not to be used for the explicit recording of an absence (or negative presence) of a problem or diagnosis, for example ‚ÄòNo known problem or diagnoses‚Äô or ‚ÄòNo known diabetes‚Äô. Use the EVALUATION.exclusion-problem_diagnosis archetype to express a positive statement about exclusion of a problem or diagnosis.

es.purpose:
Este arquetipo se utilizar√° para registrar un √∫nico problema de salud o diagn√≥stico identificado para el paciente.

El alcance del arquetipo se dej√≥ deliberadamente abierto, para poder capturar cualquier inquietud real o percibida que afecte en cualquier grado la salud de un paciente. Independientemente de qui√©n detecte el problema, el diagn√≥stico debe ser definido basado en criterios cl√≠nicos objetivos, determinados por un profesional cl√≠nico.
es.use: Este arquetipo se utilizar√° para registrar un √∫nico problema de salud o diagn√≥stico identificado para el paciente.
es.misuse:
No se debe utilizar para registrar s√≠ntomas descritos por el paciente, para eso utilizar el arquetipo CLUSTER.symtom.

No se debe utilizar para registrar hallazgos, para eso utilizar arquetipos relacionados con la examinaci√≥n, usualmente relacionados con el arquetipo OBSERVATION.exam

No se debe utilizar para registrar diagn√≥sticos realizados sobre resultados de estudios diagn√≥sticos como laboratorio o imagenolog√≠a.

No se debe utilizar para registrar el motivo de consulta o problema presentado por el paciente, para eso utilizar el arquetipo EVALUATION.reason_for_encounter

No se debe utilizar para registrar riesgos o problemas potenciales, para eso utilizar el arquetipo EVALUATION.health_risk

No se debe utilizar para registrar la ausencia de un problema, para eso utilizar el arquetipo EVALUATION.exclusion-problem_diagnosis

de.purpose: Zur Darstellung der klinischen Klassifikation und die Einteilung der Malignit√§t in Stadien anhand des TNM-Systems.
keywords: TNM, Krebs, Tumor, cTNM, Grading, Einstufung, Malignit√§t, Klassifikation, Einteilung, Stadium, Neoplasie
de.use:
Zur Darstellung der klinischen Klassifikation, als TNM oder cTNM bezeichnet, und der Stadieneinteilung der Malignit√§t.

Dieser Archetyp wurde entworfen, um in einem ENTRY-Archetyp, der einen klinischen Kontext und den Tumortyp f√ºr den TNM-Datensatz bereitstellt, verschachtelt zu werden - zum Beispiel: der SLOT "Spezifische Angaben" im Archetyp EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis.

Jeder Krebs hat einen Satz eindeutigen TNM-Klassifikationswerte. Dieser Archetyp kann unter Verwendung einer Spezialisierung oder eines Templates f√ºr jede Tumorentit√§t und jede Auflage der TNM-Klassifikation weiter eingeschr√§nkt werden, um individuelle Anforderungen zu ber√ºcksichtigen.

Bei bestimmten Tumorarten, wie Hodgkin-Lymphomen und anderen Non-Hodgkin-Lymphomen, wird zur Bestimmung des Ausma√ües und der Prognose von Krankheiten ein anderes System verwendet. In diesem Fall wird nur die Stadieneinteilung definiert.
de.misuse: Nicht zur Darstellung der pathologischen TNM-Klassifikation verwenden - verwenden Sie f√ºr diesen Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.tnm-pathological.

nb.purpose: For √• registrere klinisk klassifikasjon og stadium av maligne tumorer ved √• bruke TNM-systemet.
keywords: TNM, kreft, svulst, tumor, cTNM, gradering, staging, malignitet, klassifikasjon, gruppering, stage, neoplasi, neoplastisk vekst, metastase, spredning, canser, cancer, malign tumor, stadie, stadium, carcinoma, karsinom
nb.use:
Brukes for √• klassifisere og angi stadium av maligne tumorer, betegnet som TNM eller cTNM.

Arketypen er laget for √• benyttes i en ENTRY arketype som vil gi den kliniske konteksten for TNM registreringen og typen tumor. For eksempel: I SLOTet "Spesifikke detaljer" i arketypen EVALUATION.problem_diagnose (Problem/diagnose).

Hver kreftform har et sett av unike TNM klassifikasjonsverdier. Det er antatt at denne arketypen blir tilpasset for √• ivareta de unike kravene for hver type tumor og aktuell utgave av TNM-klassifikasjonen, enten ved √• bruke en spesialisering av arketypen eller ved √• justere i et templat.

For noen bestemte kreftformer, som Hodgkins eller non-Hodgkins lymfom vil andre klassifikasjonssystemer benyttes for √• angi omfang av sykdom eller prognose. I disse tilfellene vil kun stadium defineres.
nb.misuse: Skal ikke brukes for √• registrere patologisk TNM-klassifikasjon. Bruk arketypen CLUSTER.tnm-pathological (TNM-klassifikasjon patologi) for dette form√•let.

en.purpose: To record the clinical classification and stage grouping of malignancies using the TNM system.
keywords: TNM, cancer, tumour, cTNM, grading, staging, malignancy, classification, grouping, stage, neoplasia
en.use:
Use to record the clinical classification, designated as TNM or cTNM, and stage grouping of malignancies.

This archetype has been designed to be nested inside an ENTRY archetype which will provide a clinical context and the tumour type for the TNM record - for example: the 'Specific details' SLOT within the EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis archetype.

Each cancer has a set of unique TNM classification values. It is expected that this archetype will be further constrained to reflect the unique requirements for each tumour and edition of the TNM classification, using either an archetype specialisation or a template.

With certain types of tumours, such as Hodgkin and other non-Hodgkin lymphomas, a different system for designating the extent of disease and prognosis is used. In these circumstances only the stage group is defined.
en.misuse: Not to be used to record the TNM pathological classification - use the CLUSTER.tnm-pathological archetype for this purpose.

nb.purpose: For √• registrere eksplisitte detaljer om grunnlaget for et klinisk utsagn, for eksempel en problem/diagnose, risiko for overf√∏lsomhetsreaksjon, helserisiko, eller kontraindikasjon.
nb.use:
Brukes for √• registrere eksplisitte detaljer om grunnlaget for et klinisk utsagn, enten som en oppsummering av data som er tilgjengelig i andre arketyper (ofte av OBSERVATION-klassen), eller n√•r de opprinnelige dataene ikke er tilgjengelige for applikasjonen.

Denne arketypen er ment √• legges i et SLOT i arketypene EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis, EVALUATION.adverse_reaction_risk, EVALUATION.health_risk, EVALUATION.contraindication eller lignende oppsummerende arketyper, der utsagnet allerede er spesifisert i EVALUATION-arketypen. Den fungerer der som en valgfri utvidelse av datasettet i EVALUATION-arketypen.

Som spesifisert i openEHR referansemodellen kan det benyttes lenker for √• lenke til data som ligger andre steder i journalen, mens denne arketypen er laget for √• gj√∏re dette eksplisitt, og for √• gj√∏re det mulig √• vise og gjennomg√• disse dataene klinisk der dette er relevant.

Grunnlaget kan legges direkte i denne i arketypen som et "Funn", eller referansen kan benyttes for √• peke direkte til dataene som ligger et annet sted i journalen.
nb.misuse:
Skal ikke brukes til √• registrere sammendrag om et problem eller en diagnose. For dette brukes arketypen EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis.

Skal ikke brukes til √• registrere sammendrag om risiko for overf√∏lsomhetsreaksjoner. For dette brukes arketypen EVALUATION.adverse_reaction_risk.

Skal ikke brukes til √• registrere sammendrag om en helserisiko. For dette brukes arketypen EVALUATION.health_risk.

Skal ikke brukes til √• registrere sammendrag om en kontraindikasjon. For dette brukes arketypen EVALUATION.contraindication.

en.purpose: To record an explicit finding in support of a clinical assertion, such as a problem/diagnosis, adverse reaction risk, health risk assessment, or contraindication.
en.use:
Use to record details about findings that support a clinical assertion, either as a summary of data available in other (often OBSERVATION class) archetypes, or when the original observational data is not available.

This archetype is designed to be nested within a SLOT in the EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis, EVALUATION.adverse_reaction_risk, EVALUATION.health_risk, EVALUATION.contraindication, or similar summary archetypes, where the name of the assertion has already been specified in the EVALUATION, in order to extend its content with this additional and optional dataset. While LINKs within the openEHR Reference Model allow for linkage to data held elsewhere within the health record, this archetype has been developed to make this functionality explicit, and to enable clinical visibility and review of this data, where it may be relevant in a template or specification.

The clinical evidence can be entered directly into this archetype as a 'Finding', or a citation can be used to explicitly point to data within the health record.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record summary details about an identified problem or diagnosis - use the EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis for this purpose.

Not to be used to record summary details about an identified adverse reaction risk - use the EVALUATION.adverse_reaction_risk for this purpose.

Not to be used to record summary details about an identified health risk - use the EVALUATION.health_risk for this purpose.

Not to be used to record summary details about an identified contraindication - use the EVALUATION.contraindication for this purpose.

en.purpose: To record an explicit finding in support of a clinical assertion, such as a problem/diagnosis, adverse reaction risk, health risk assessment, or contraindication.
en.use:
Use to record details about findings that support a clinical assertion, either as a summary of data available in other (often OBSERVATION class) archetypes, or when the original observational data is not available.

This archetype is designed to be nested within a SLOT in the EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis, EVALUATION.adverse_reaction_risk, EVALUATION.health_risk, EVALUATION.contraindication, or similar summary archetypes, where the name of the assertion has already been specified in the EVALUATION, in order to extend its content with this additional and optional dataset. While LINKs within the openEHR Reference Model allow for linkage to data held elsewhere within the health record, this archetype has been developed to make this functionality explicit, and to enable clinical visibility and review of this data, where it may be relevant in a template or specification.

The clinical evidence can be entered directly into this archetype as a 'Finding', or a citation can be used to explicitly point to data within the health record.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record summary details about an identified problem or diagnosis - use the EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis for this purpose.

Not to be used to record summary details about an identified adverse reaction risk - use the EVALUATION.adverse_reaction_risk for this purpose.

Not to be used to record summary details about an identified health risk - use the EVALUATION.health_risk for this purpose.

Not to be used to record summary details about an identified contraindication - use the EVALUATION.contraindication for this purpose.

Einschlie√ülich aber nicht beschr√§nkt auf: Tests f√ºr Biochemie, H√§matologie, Immunologie und Blutspendendienste etc. sowie spezifische Muster f√ºr die besonderen Anforderungen an Mikrobiologie und anatomische Pathologie. Wenn die in Auftrag gegebenen Tests oder Untersuchungen nicht gew√∂hnlich in einer benannten Gruppe oder einem benannten Panel zusammengeh√∂ren, wird jedes Testergebnis in der Regel durch separate Instanzen dieses Archetyps dargestellt. Dieser Archetyp unterst√ºtzt mehrere Ans√§tze zur Erfassung von Proben und spiegelt die aktuelle, sehr unterschiedliche Praxis wieder. Ein Laborergebnis hat einen hohen Grad an √úbereinstimmung mit einer HL7 FHIR Diagnoseberichtsquelle. 

Es wird erwartet, dass ein oder mehrere Exemplare dieses Archetyps oder dieser Archetypfamilie an einen anfragenden Arzt innerhalb eines Labordokuments zur√ºckgeschickt werden, das COMPOSITION.report_result Archetyp, oder √§hnliche und andere relevante ENTRY Archetypen.

Wenn die St√∂rfaktoren komplexer sind, kann es sinnvoll sein, einen lokalen/gemeinsamen CLUSTER-Archetyp zu erstellen, der im SLOT "Confounding factors details" erg√§nzt werden kann. 
Hinweis 1: Bekannte oder erforderliche Voraussetzungen, wie z.B. "Fasten" oder "Tag 1 des Menstruationszyklus", sollten im Datenelement "Probenbedingungen" im Archetyp CLUSTER.Probe, verschachtelt innerhalb des OBSERVATION Archetypes, angegeben werden.

Werden vom Labor "Reflextests" durchgef√ºhrt, k√∂nnen diese gem√§√ü den US/FHIR-Richtlinien (siehe https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreportguide.html) oder anderen lokalen Richtlinien durchgef√ºhrt werden. Zum Beispiel eine der folgenden Punkte....

3. Protokollierung der Reflextestergebnisse zus√§tzliche "Testergebnisse" innerhalb derselben "openEHR-EHROBSERVATION.Laborergebnis" festhalten, aber √ºber "Testerforderungsdetails" auf einen neuen Labortestantrag sowie den urspr√ºnglichen Labortestantrag verweisen.

Nicht zur Dokumentation eines Autopsieberichts oder eines forensischen Berichts verwenden. Einzelne Proben, die bei einer Autopsie oder einem forensischen Bericht entnommen werden, k√∂nnen jedoch mit diesem Archetyp dargestellt werden. Dieser Archetyp eignet sich zur Darstellung allgemeiner Labortestergebnisse, jedoch nicht f√ºr vollst√§ndige synoptische Berichte. F√ºr diese sind zus√§tzliche spezialisierte Archetypen erforderlich, um die Daten zu dokumentieren.

Den h√§r arketypen st√∂der flera tillv√§gag√•ngss√§tt f√∂r inspelning av exemplar, vilket √•terspeglar nuvarande praxis som varierar enormt. Ett laboratorietestresultat har en h√∂g grad av anpassning till en HL7 FHIR-diagnosrapportresurs.

Denna arketyp st√∂der flera metoder f√∂r att registrera information om provmaterialet, vilket √•terspeglar de stora variationerna inom nuvarande praxis. Arketypen f√∂r laboratoriesvar har en h√∂g grad av √∂verensst√§mmelse med HL7 FHIR-resursen "Diagnostic Report".

Registrering av m√∂jliga felk√§llor g√∂rs i praktiken oftast inte p√• ett konsekvent s√§tt. Om m√∂jliga felk√§llor √§r av det mer mer komplexa slaget, kan det vara l√§mpligt att skapa en CLUSTER-arketyp som kan anv√§ndas i SLOT '' Confounding factors details ''.

nb.purpose: For √• registrere resultat, funn og laboratoriets tolkning, av en laboratorieunders√∏kelse utf√∏rt p√• pr√∏vemateriale fra et individ eller relatert til individet.
nb.use:
Brukes for √• registrere resultat, funn og laboratoriets tolkning, av en laboratorieunders√∏kelse utf√∏rt p√• pr√∏vemateriale fra et individ eller relatert til individet. Denne arketypen er ment √• dekke resultatet av √©n rekvirert unders√∏kelse der pr√∏vene er tatt i √©n prosedyre, og som kan ha flere analyseresultater eller andre komponenter. Der laboratoriet endrer analyser eller legger til analyser som oppf√∏lging, kan disse h√•ndteres etter veilledning fra HL7 FHIR (https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreport-guide.html), eller etter lokale prosedyrer. For eksempel en av f√∏lgende:

For √• lage selve obduksjons- eller den rettsmedisinske rapporten m√• man bruke spesialiserte arketyper.

Denne arketypen er passende for √• representere generelle laboratoriesvar, men er ikke ment √• dekke komplette sammendragsrapporter ("synoptic reports") innenfor patologi. For disse trengs det i tillegg spesialiserte arketyper.

en.purpose: To record the result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual.
en.use:
Use to record the result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual. This is typically done in a laboratory, but may be done in other environments such as at the point of care.

This archetype is intended to cover the result of a single ordered investigation where the specimen(s) are collected as a single procedure, and may include multiple analyte results or other components. Examples of this could include 'Full blood count', which would yield a separate analyte result for the count of each type of blood cell, or 'kidney biopsy non-neoplastic', which would yield findings from microscopy, immunohistochemistry and electron microscopy.

This archetype has been designed to be a framework that will usually be extended with CLUSTER archetypes to enable appropriate recording of specific laboratory test result patterns. This includes, but is not limited to, tests for biochemistry, haematology, immunology and transfusion services etc and specific patterns for the unique requirements for microbiology and anatomical pathology. If the ordered tests or investigations do not commonly belong together in a named group or panel, each test result would normally be represented using separate instances of this archetype. There is, however, considerable variation in actual reporting/messaging practice and this archetype/related archetypes are designed to handle such variation.

This archetype supports multiple approaches to recording of specimen, reflecting current practice which varies enormously. A Laboratory test result has a high degree of alignment to an HL7 FHIR Diagnostic Report resource.

it.purpose: Registrare il risultato, compresi i riscontri e l'interpretazione del laboratorio, di un'indagine effettuata su campioni raccolti su un individuo o relativi a quell'individuo.
keywords: lab, patologia, biochimica, ematologia, microbiologia, immunologia, laboratorio, anatomia, chimica, clinica, immunopatologia, citologia, istopatologia, test, biopsia, campione, medicina legale, genetica, medicina di laboratorio, risultati, analisi
it.use:
Utilizzato per registrare il risultato, compresi i riscontri e l'interpretazione del laboratorio, di un'indagine effettuata su campioni raccolti su un individuo o relativi a quell'individuo. Questo √® tipicamente fatto in un laboratorio, ma pu√≤ essere fatto in altri ambienti, come ad esempio al punto di cura.

Questo archetipo √® inteso per coprire il risultato di una singola indagine ordinata in cui il campione o i campioni sono raccolti come un'unica procedura, e pu√≤ includere risultati di analiti multipli o altri componenti. Esempi di ci√≤ potrebbero includere l' "emocromo completo", che darebbe un risultato dell'analisi separato per il conteggio di ciascun tipo di cellula del sangue, o la "biopsia renale non neoplastica", che darebbe risultati da microscopia, immunoistochimica e microscopia elettronica.

Questo archetipo √® stato progettato per essere un quadro di riferimento che di solito viene esteso con archetipi CLUSTER per consentire la registrazione appropriata di specifici modelli di risultati di test di laboratorio. Questo include, ma non si limita ai test per la biochimica, l'ematologia, l'immunologia e i servizi trasfusionali, ecc. e pattern specifici per i requisiti specializzati per microbiologia e anatomia patologica. Se i test o le indagini ordinati non appartengono comunemente a un gruppo o a un panel, ogni risultato di test verrebbe normalmente rappresentato utilizzando istanze separate di questo archetipo. Vi √®, tuttavia, una notevole variazione nella pratica effettiva di refertazione/comunicazione e questo archetipo e gli archetipi correlati sono progettati per gestire tale variazione.

Questo archetipo supporta approcci multipli alla registrazione dei campioni, riflettendo la pratica corrente che varia enormemente. Il risultato di un test di laboratorio ha un alto grado di allineamento con la risorsa HL7 FHIR Diagnostic Report.

Si prevede che una o pi√π istanze di questo archetipo, o famiglia di archetipi, saranno inviate ad un clinico richiedente all'interno di un documento di rapporto di laboratorio che comprende l'archetipo COMPOSITION.report_result, o simile, e altri archetipi ENTRY rilevanti.

La registrazione dei fattori di confusione pu√≤ essere incoerente, spesso a seconda del laboratorio di analisi e delle informazioni cliniche inviate dal richiedente. Nella sezione Stato dell'archetipo c'√® un semplice elemento ("fattori di confondimento"), che √® facoltativo e pu√≤ essere ripetuto come un modo per registrare una variet√† di semplici fattori che devono essere resi espliciti in quanto possono influenzare l'interpretazione dei risultati. Se i fattori confondenti sono pi√π complessi, pu√≤ essere opportuno creare un archetipo CLUSTER locale o condiviso, che pu√≤ essere annidato nello SLOT "Dettagli dei fattori confondenti".
Nota 1: Le precondizioni conosciute o richieste, come il 'digiuno' o il 'Giorno 1 del ciclo mestruale', devono essere riportate nell'elemento di dati 'Condizioni di campionamento' dell'archetipo CLUSTER.specimen, annidato all'interno di questo archetipo OSSERVAZIONE.
Nota 2: I problemi noti relativi alla raccolta o al trattamento dei campioni, come "emolisi del campione" o "uso prolungato del laccio emostatico", devono essere riportati in "Qualit√† del campione" nell'archetipo CLUSTER.specimen, annidato all'interno di questo archetipo OBSERVATION.

Se i "reflex test" vengono eseguiti dal laboratorio, questi possono essere gestiti secondo le linee guida US/FHIR (vedi https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreport-guide.html) o altre politiche locali. Ad esempio, uno dei seguenti ...
1. Registrare i risultati addizionali dei reflex test come 'Risultati dei test' all'interno dello stesso 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result'.
2. 2. Registrare i risultati del reflex test come 'Risultati del test' all'interno di un nuovo 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result', ma fare riferimento alla richiesta originale del test di laboratorio tramite 'Dettagli della richiesta di test'.
3. 3. Registrare i risultati del reflex test come 'Risultati del test' all'interno di un nuovo 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result', ma fare riferimento alla nuova richiesta di test di laboratorio insieme alla richiesta originale di test di laboratorio tramite 'Dettagli della richiesta di test'.
it.misuse:
Da non utilizzare per registrare un'autopsia o un rapporto forense, anche se i test su alcuni campioni prelevati in tali situazioni possono essere rappresentati utilizzando questo archetipo. Per questi, saranno necessari archetipi aggiuntivi o specializzati per rappresentare i dati.

Questo archetipo √® adatto per la rappresentazione dei risultati generali dei test di laboratorio, ma non √® destinato a coprire i rapporti sinottici completi. Per questi, sono necessari ulteriori archetipi specializzati per rappresentare i dati.

This includes, but is not limited to, tests for biochemistry, haematology, immunology and transfusion services etc and specific patterns for the unique requirements for microbiology and anatomical pathology. If the ordered tests or investigations do not commonly belong together in a named group or panel, each test result would normally be represented using separate instances of this archetype. There is, however, considerable variation in actual reporting/messaging practice and this archetype/related archetypes are designed to handle such variation.

Note 1: Known or required pre-conditions, such as 'fasting' or 'Day 1 of menstrual cycle', should be reported in the 'Sampling conditions' data element in the CLUSTER.specimen archetype, nested within this OBSERVATION archetype.
Note 2: Known issues with specimen collection or handling, such as 'sample haemolysed' or 'prolonged use of tourniquet' should be reported within 'Specimen quality' in the CLUSTER.specimen archetype, nested within this OBSERVATION archetype.

Where 'reflex tests' are performed by the laboratory, these may be handled as per US/FHIR guidance (see https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreport-guide.html) or other local policy. For example, one of the following ...
1. Record the reflex test results additional 'Test findings' within the same 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result'
2. Record the reflex test results as 'Test findings' within a new 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result' but refer to the original lab test request via 'Test request details'.
3. Record the reflex test results as 'Test findings' within a new 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result' but reference a new lab test request as well as the original lab test request via 'Test request details'.(en)

de.purpose: Zur Identifikation und Dokumentation von strukturierten Daten bez√ºglich einer bestimmten K√∂rperstelle oder innerhalb des menschlichen K√∂rpers, unter Verwendung makroskopischer anatomischer Fachbegriffe.
de.use:
Zur Dokumentation von strukturierten und konsistenten Details eines einzelnen bestimmten physischen Bereich innerhalb des menschlichen K√∂rpers verwenden.

Dieser Archetyp wurde speziell f√ºr die Verwendung im Rahmen von allen geeigneten ENTRY- oder CLUSTER-Archetypen entwickelt, die den Kontext des anatomischen Fundortes liefern.

Als grundlegender Bestandteil der klinischen Praxis, k√∂nnen Mediziner anatomische Lokalisationen auf einer Vielzahl von komplexen und variablen Wegen definieren. In der Praxis tragen einige Archetypen ein einziges Datenelement f√ºr eine einfache Beschreibung der K√∂rperstelle - zum Beispiel OBSERVATION.blood_pressure und CLUSTER.symptom bei der Beschreibung von Ohrenschmerzen. In dieser Situation, in der die Wertemenge berechenbar und simpel zu definieren ist, ist dieses einzelne Datenelement eine sehr genaue und pragmatische M√∂glichkeit, die Stelle im K√∂rper zu protokollieren und zu einem sp√§teren Zeitpunkt abzufragen. In der Situation, in der die anatomische Lage nicht genau definiert ist oder zur Laufzeit bestimmt werden muss, kann es flexibler sein, diesen strukturierten Archetyp zu verwenden. Wenn zum Beispiel jedes Symptom ohne einen vordefinierten Umfang der Symptomatik aufgezeichnet werden kann, dann ist es sinnvoll, diesen Archetyp zu verwenden, um eine spezifische anatomische Lokalisation im K√∂rper zu definieren. In diesem Fall tr√§gt der CLUSTER.symptom Archetyp auch einen SLOT f√ºr 'Detaillierte anatomische Lokalisation', der diesen Archetyp enthalten kann, um maximale Flexibilit√§t bei der Erfassung der Daten zur anatomischen Lage zu gew√§hrleisten.

Dieser Archetyp unterst√ºtzt die Aufnahme von komplex strukturierten anatomischen Stellen. Beispielsweise findet sich der Scheitelpunkt des Herzens typischerweise am f√ºnften linken Interkostalraum in der Mittelklavikularlinie, Schmerzempfindlichkeit am McBurney-Punkt an der Bauchdecke oder eine Risswunde an der Handfl√§cheninnenseite des proximalen rechten Daumens.

Eine Kombination der Datenelemente in diesem Archetyp kann verwendet werden, um jede Komponente eines postkoordinierten Terminologieausdrucks, der den anatomischen Bereich repr√§sentiert, individuell zu dokumentieren.

Der SLOT "Alternative Struktur" erlaubt die Aufnahme zus√§tzlicher Archetypen, die eine alternative Struktur zur Beschreibung derselben K√∂rperstelle bieten, wie z.B. CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative oder CLUSTER.anatomical_location_clock, falls dies ben√∂tigt wird. Wenn dieser Archetyp nur zur Benennung eines gro√üen und/oder unspezifischen K√∂rperteils verwendet werden kann, unterst√ºtzt die zus√§tzliche Verwendung des Archetyps CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative die Aufnahme einer genaueren Position - zum Beispiel 2 cm vor der kubitalen Fossa des linken Unterarms oder 4 cm unter dem Rippenrand an der Brustwand in der Mittelklavikularlinie.

Wenn dieser Archetyp in anderen Archetypen verwendet wird, in denen das angegebene Thema nicht die Person ist, f√ºr die der Datensatz erstellt wird, z.B. ein F√∂tus in-utero, dann wird der anatomische Ort eine K√∂rperstelle auf oder innerhalb des F√∂tus identifizieren."
de.misuse: *Not to be used for specifiying unilateral/bilateral occurrences of an anatomical feature.(en)

sv.purpose: Att identifiera och strukturerat registrera detaljer om en enskild del p√• eller i m√§nniskokroppen genom att anv√§nda termer inom makroskopisk anatomi.
sv.use:
Anv√§nds f√∂r att p√• ett strukturerat och konsekvent vis registrera detaljer om ett enskilt fysiskt st√§lle p√• eller i m√§nniskokroppen.

Arketypen √§r specifikt utformad f√∂r att anv√§ndas i l√§mpliga ENTRY- och CLUSTER-arketyper som s√§tter den anatomiska lokalisationen i ett sammanhang.

Som en grundl√§ggande del av klinisk praxis kan kliniker beskriva anatomiska platser p√• en m√§ngd olika s√§tt. Vissa arketyper inneh√•ller ett enkelt dataelement f√∂r enkel beskrivning av en kroppslig plats - till exempel OBSERVATION.blood_pressure och CLUSTER.symptoms n√§r man beskriver sm√§rta i √∂rat. I denna situation, d√§r upps√§ttningen v√§rden √§r f√∂ruts√§gbar och l√§tt att definiera, √§r detta enkla dataelement ett mycket exakt och praktiskt s√§tt att registrera en anatomisk plats p√• eller i kroppen och s√∂ka efter den vid ett senare tillf√§lle. Men n√§r den anatomiska platsen inte √§r v√§ldefinierad eller beh√∂ver definieras kontinuerligt kan det vara mer flexibelt att anv√§nda denna strukturerade arketyp. Till exempel, i en situation d√§r symptom ska registreras utan f√∂rkunskap om vilka typer av symptom det kan vara, kan denna arketyp vara anv√§ndbar f√∂r att definiera en anatomisk plats i kroppen. I det h√§r fallet har CLUSTER.symptom-arketypen en "Lokalisation"-SLOT som kan inneh√•lla denna arketyp f√∂r att st√∂dja maximal flexibilitet vid registrering av anatomiska platsdata.

Arketypen st√∂der registrering av komplexa strukturerade anatomiska platser. Till exempel finns hj√§rtspetsst√∂ten typiskt i mitralomr√•det, √∂mhet vid McBurneys punkt p√• bukenv√§ggen eller s√•rskada p√• handflatan av den proximala h√∂gra tummen.

En kombination av dataelement i den h√§r arketypen kan anv√§ndas f√∂r att registrera varje komponent i ett postkoordinerat terminologiskt uttryck som representerar den anatomiska platsen.

SLOT f√∂r ''Alternativ struktur '' m√∂jligg√∂r anv√§ndning av ytterligare arketyper som ger en alternativ struktur f√∂r beskrivning av samma kroppsplats, s√•som CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative eller CLUSTER.anatomical_location_circle, om detta skulle kr√§vas. I den situation d√§r den h√§r arketypen endast kan anv√§ndas f√∂r att namnge en stor och/eller ospecifik kroppsdel, kan ‚ÄùCLUSTER. Anatomical_location_relative‚Äù-arketypen anv√§ndas f√∂r att registrera en mer exakt plats ‚Äì till exempel 2 cm fr√§mre √§n fossa cubitalis p√• v√§nster arm eller 4 cm under revbensb√•gen i medioklavikularlinjen p√• br√∂stv√§ggen.

Om denna arketyp anv√§nds i andra arketyper d√§r patienten inte √§r den som dokumentationen syftar till, till exempel foster-in-utero, kommer den anatomiska lokalisationen att identifieras som en lokalisation p√• eller i fostrets kropp.

en.purpose: To identify and record structured details about a single physical site on, or within, the human body using macroscopic anatomical terms.
en.use:
Use to record structured and consistent details about a single identified physical site on, or within, the human body. 

This archetype is specifically designed to be used within the context of any appropriate ENTRY or CLUSTER archetypes which supply the context of the anatomical location. 

As a fundamental part of clinical practice, clinicians can describe anatomical locations in a myriad of complex and variable ways. In practice, some archetypes carry a single data element for carrying a simple description of body site - for example, OBSERVATION.blood_pressure and CLUSTER.symptom when describing ear pain. In this situation, where the value set is predictable and simple to define, this single data element is a very accurate and pragmatic way to record the site in the body and to query at a later date. However in the situation where the anatomical location is not well defined or needs to be determined at run-time, it may be more flexible to use this structured archetype. For example, in the situation where any symptom can be recorded without any predefined scope of the type of symptom, then allowing the use of this archetype to specifically define an anatomical location in the body may be useful. In this case the CLUSTER.symptom archetype also carries a SLOT for 'Detailed anatomical location' which can include this archetype to support maximal flexibility in recording anatomical location data.

This archetype supports recording complex structured anatomical sites. For example, the apex beat of the heart is typically found at the fifth left intercostal space in the mid-clavicular line, tenderness at McBurney's point on the abdominal wall or a laceration on the palmar aspect of the proximal right thumb.

A combination of the data elements in this archetype can be used to individually record each component of a postcoordinated terminology expression that represents the anatomical site.

The 'Alternative structure' SLOT allows inclusion of additional archetypes that provide an alternative structure for describing the same body site, such as CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative or CLUSTER.anatomical_location_clock, should this be required. In the situation where this archetype can only be used to name a large and/or non-specific body part, the additional use of the CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative archetype will support recording of a more precise location - for example, 2 cm anterior to the cubital fossa of the left forearm or 4 cm below R costal margin on the chest wall in the mid-clavicular line.

If this archetype is used within other archetypes where the specified subject of care is not the individual for whom the record is being created, for example a fetus in-utero, then the anatomical location will be identifying a body site on or within the fetus.
en.misuse: Not to be used for specifiying unilateral/bilateral occurrences of an anatomical feature.

en.purpose: To record the findings and interpretation of anatomical pathology tests performed on tissues, cells and body fluids.

de.use:
Zur Dokumentation des Ergebnisses - einschlie√ülich der Befunde und der Interpretation des Labors - einer Untersuchung, die an Proben durchgef√ºhrt wurde, die von einer Einzelperson stammen oder mit dieser Person zusammenh√§ngen. Registrering av m√∂jliga felk√§llor g√∂rs i praktiken oftast inte p√• ett konsekvent s√§tt. Om m√∂jliga felk√§llor √§r av det mer mer komplexa slaget, kan det vara l√§mpligt att skapa en CLUSTER-arketyp som kan anv√§ndas i SLOT '' Confounding factors details ''.

Om laboratoriet √§ndrar analyser eller l√§gger till analyser som uppf√∂ljning kan dessa hanteras enligt riktlinjer fr√•n HL7 FHIR (https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreport-guide.html), eller enligt lokala f√∂rfaranden. Till exempel n√•got av f√∂ljande:

sv.misuse:
B√∂r inte anv√§ndas f√∂r att lagra en sammanst√§llning efter obduktion eller r√§ttsmedicinsk unders√∂kning, √§ven om testresultat f√∂r vissa provmaterial som tagits vid en obduktion kan representeras i denna arketyp. F√∂r att skapa den verkliga obduktionen eller kriminaltekniska rapporten m√•ste man anv√§nda specialiserade arketyper.

Denna arketyp √§r l√§mplig f√∂r att representera allm√§nna laboratoriesvar, men √§r inte avsedd att t√§cka fullst√§ndiga synoptiska rapporter inom patologi. F√∂r dessa beh√∂vs ocks√• specialiserade arketyper.

nb.purpose: For √• registrere resultat, funn og laboratoriets tolkning, av en laboratorieunders√∏kelse utf√∏rt p√• pr√∏vemateriale fra et individ eller relatert til individet.
nb.use:
Brukes for √• registrere resultat, funn og laboratoriets tolkning, av en laboratorieunders√∏kelse utf√∏rt p√• pr√∏vemateriale fra et individ eller relatert til individet. Dette utf√∏res typisk i et laboratorium, men kan ogs√• gj√∏res i andre milj√∏er, som for eksempel ved pasientn√¶r analysering.

Denne arketypen er ment √• dekke resultatet av √©n rekvirert unders√∏kelse der pr√∏vene er tatt i √©n prosedyre, og som kan ha flere analyseresultater eller andre komponenter. Eksempler p√• dette kan v√¶re "Differensialtelling av leukocytter", som gir et separat resultat for antallet av hver type hvite blodceller, eller "Nyrebiopsi ikke-neoplastisk", som gir resultater fra mikroskopi, immunohistokjemi og elektronmikroskopi.

Denne arketypen er laget for √• v√¶re et rammeverk som vanligvis vil utvides med CLUSTER-arketyper for √• f√• en hensiktsmessig registrering og rapportering av spesifikke m√∏nstre for laboratorieresultater. Dette kan omfatte analyser og unders√∏kelser innen kjemi (medisinsk biokjemi, hematologi, immunologi og transfusjonsmedisin, med mer), samt spesifikke m√∏nstre for de unike behovene innenfor mikrobiologi og patologi. Hvis de rekvirerte analysene eller unders√∏kelsene ikke tilh√∏rer en navngitt gruppe, vil hvert resultat normalt representeres ved en separat instans av denne arketypen. Imidlertid er det stor variasjon p√• hvordan svarrapportering/meldingsformidling skjer, og denne arketypen er designet for √• ivareta disse variasjonene.

Denne arketypen st√∏tter flere tiln√¶rminger til √• registrere informasjon om pr√∏vematerialet, noe som reflekterer de store variasjonene innenfor dagens praksis. Laboratoriesvar-arketypen har h√∏y grad av samsvar med HL7 FHIR-ressursen "Diagnostic Report".

Det forventes at en eller flere instanser av denne arketypen, eller arketypefamilen vil bli sendt tilbake til rekvirenten i en laboratoriesvarrapport, for eksempel i arketypen COMPOSITION.report_result eller tilsvarende, og sammen med relevante ENTRY-arketyper.

Registrering av konfunderende faktorer gj√∏res i praksis ikke p√• en konsistent m√•te, og avhenger av avsenderlaboratoriet og av den kliniske informasjonen som ble sendt med fra rekvirenten. NB 2: Kjente problemer med pr√∏vetaking eller pr√∏veh√•ndtering, som for eksempel "hemolyse" eller "forlenget stase" b√∏r registreres i elementet "Pr√∏vekvalitet" i arketypen CLUSTER.specimen, og n√∏stes inn i denne OBSERVATION-arketypen.

Der laboratoriet endrer analyser eller legger til analyser som oppf√∏lging, kan disse h√•ndteres etter veilledning fra HL7 FHIR (https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreport-guide.html), eller etter lokale prosedyrer. For eksempel en av f√∏lgende:
1. Registrer de endrede analysene/tilleggsanalysene innenfor samme instans av denne arketypen.
2. Registrer de endrede analysene/tilleggsanalysene i en ny instans av denne arketypen, men referer til den opprinnelige rekvisisjonen ved hjelp av "Rekvisisjonsdetaljer".
3. Registrer de endrede analysene/tilleggsanalysene i en ny instans av denne arketypen, men referer til en ny rekvisisjon i tillegg til den opprinnelige rekvisisjonen, ved hjelp av "Rekvisisjonsdetaljer".
nb.misuse:
Skal ikke brukes for √• lagre en sammenstilling etter obduksjon eller rettsmedisinsk unders√∏kelse, selv om pr√∏ver av noen pr√∏vematerialer som blir tatt i en obduksjon kan bli representert i denne arketypen. For √• lage selve obduksjons- eller den rettsmedisinske rapporten m√• man bruke spesialiserte arketyper.

Denne arketypen er passende for √• representere generelle laboratoriesvar, men er ikke ment √• dekke komplette sammendragsrapporter ("synoptic reports") innenfor patologi. For disse trengs det i tillegg spesialiserte arketyper.

en.purpose: To record the result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual.
en.use:
Use to record the result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual. This is typically done in a laboratory, but may be done in other environments such as at the point of care.

This archetype is intended to cover the result of a single ordered investigation where the specimen(s) are collected as a single procedure, and may include multiple analyte results or other components. Examples of this could include 'Full blood count', which would yield a separate analyte result for the count of each type of blood cell, or 'kidney biopsy non-neoplastic', which would yield findings from microscopy, immunohistochemistry and electron microscopy.

This archetype has been designed to be a framework that will usually be extended with CLUSTER archetypes to enable appropriate recording of specific laboratory test result patterns. This includes, but is not limited to, tests for biochemistry, haematology, immunology and transfusion services etc and specific patterns for the unique requirements for microbiology and anatomical pathology. If the ordered tests or investigations do not commonly belong together in a named group or panel, each test result would normally be represented using separate instances of this archetype. There is, however, considerable variation in actual reporting/messaging practice and this archetype/related archetypes are designed to handle such variation.

This archetype supports multiple approaches to recording of specimen, reflecting current practice which varies enormously. A Laboratory test result has a high degree of alignment to an HL7 FHIR Diagnostic Report resource.

It is anticipated that one or more instances of this archetype, or archetype family, will be sent back to a requesting clinician within a laboratory report document comprising COMPOSITION.report_result archetype, or similar, and other relevant ENTRY archetypes.

The recording of confounding factors may be inconsistent, often depending on the analysing laboratory and on clinical information sent by the requester. In the State section of the archetype there is a simple 'Confounding factors' data element that is optional and can be repeated as one way to record a variety of simple factors that need to be made explicit as they may influence interpretation of the results. If the confounding factors are more complex, it may be appropriate to create a local/shared CLUSTER archetype that can be nested in the 'Confounding factors details' SLOT. 
Note 1: Known or required pre-conditions, such as 'fasting' or 'Day 1 of menstrual cycle', should be reported in the 'Sampling conditions' data element in the CLUSTER.specimen archetype, nested within this OBSERVATION archetype.
Note 2: Known issues with specimen collection or handling, such as 'sample haemolysed' or 'prolonged use of tourniquet' should be reported within 'Specimen quality' in the CLUSTER.specimen archetype, nested within this OBSERVATION archetype.

Where 'reflex tests' are performed by the laboratory, these may be handled as per US/FHIR guidance (see https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreport-guide.html) or other local policy. For example, one of the following ...
1. Record the reflex test results additional 'Test findings' within the same 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result'
2. Record the reflex test results as 'Test findings' within a new 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result' but refer to the original lab test request via 'Test request details'.
3. Record the reflex test results as 'Test findings' within a new 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result' but reference a new lab test request as well as the original lab test request via 'Test request details'.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record an Autopsy or a Forensic report, although tests on some specimens that are taken in such situations may be represented using this archetype. For these, additional or specialised archetypes will be required to represent the data.

This archetype is suitable for representation of general laboratory test results, but not intended to cover full synoptic reports. For these, additional specialising archetypes are required to represent the data.

it.purpose: Registrare il risultato, compresi i riscontri e l'interpretazione del laboratorio, di un'indagine effettuata su campioni raccolti su un individuo o relativi a quell'individuo.
keywords: lab, patologia, biochimica, ematologia, microbiologia, immunologia, laboratorio, anatomia, chimica, clinica, immunopatologia, citologia, istopatologia, test, biopsia, campione, medicina legale, genetica, medicina di laboratorio, risultati, analisi
it.use:
Utilizzato per registrare il risultato, compresi i riscontri e l'interpretazione del laboratorio, di un'indagine effettuata su campioni raccolti su un individuo o relativi a quell'individuo. Questo √® tipicamente fatto in un laboratorio, ma pu√≤ essere fatto in altri ambienti, come ad esempio al punto di cura.

Questo archetipo √® inteso per coprire il risultato di una singola indagine ordinata in cui il campione o i campioni sono raccolti come un'unica procedura, e pu√≤ includere risultati di analiti multipli o altri componenti. Esempi di ci√≤ potrebbero includere l' "emocromo completo", che darebbe un risultato dell'analisi separato per il conteggio di ciascun tipo di cellula del sangue, o la "biopsia renale non neoplastica", che darebbe risultati da microscopia, immunoistochimica e microscopia elettronica.

Questo archetipo √® stato progettato per essere un quadro di riferimento che di solito viene esteso con archetipi CLUSTER per consentire la registrazione appropriata di specifici modelli di risultati di test di laboratorio. Questo include, ma non si limita ai test per la biochimica, l'ematologia, l'immunologia e i servizi trasfusionali, ecc. e pattern specifici per i requisiti specializzati per microbiologia e anatomia patologica. Se i test o le indagini ordinati non appartengono comunemente a un gruppo o a un panel, ogni risultato di test verrebbe normalmente rappresentato utilizzando istanze separate di questo archetipo. Vi √®, tuttavia, una notevole variazione nella pratica effettiva di refertazione/comunicazione e questo archetipo e gli archetipi correlati sono progettati per gestire tale variazione.

Questo archetipo supporta approcci multipli alla registrazione dei campioni, riflettendo la pratica corrente che varia enormemente. Il risultato di un test di laboratorio ha un alto grado di allineamento con la risorsa HL7 FHIR Diagnostic Report.

Si prevede che una o pi√π istanze di questo archetipo, o famiglia di archetipi, saranno inviate ad un clinico richiedente all'interno di un documento di rapporto di laboratorio che comprende l'archetipo COMPOSITION.report_result, o simile, e altri archetipi ENTRY rilevanti.

La registrazione dei fattori di confusione pu√≤ essere incoerente, spesso a seconda del laboratorio di analisi e delle informazioni cliniche inviate dal richiedente. Nella sezione Stato dell'archetipo c'√® un semplice elemento ("fattori di confondimento"), che √® facoltativo e pu√≤ essere ripetuto come un modo per registrare una variet√† di semplici fattori che devono essere resi espliciti in quanto possono influenzare l'interpretazione dei risultati. Se i fattori confondenti sono pi√π complessi, pu√≤ essere opportuno creare un archetipo CLUSTER locale o condiviso, che pu√≤ essere annidato nello SLOT "Dettagli dei fattori confondenti".
Nota 1: Le precondizioni conosciute o richieste, come il 'digiuno' o il 'Giorno 1 del ciclo mestruale', devono essere riportate nell'elemento di dati 'Condizioni di campionamento' dell'archetipo CLUSTER.specimen, annidato all'interno di questo archetipo OSSERVAZIONE.
Nota 2: I problemi noti relativi alla raccolta o al trattamento dei campioni, come "emolisi del campione" o "uso prolungato del laccio emostatico", devono essere riportati in "Qualit√† del campione" nell'archetipo CLUSTER.specimen, annidato all'interno di questo archetipo OBSERVATION.

Se i "reflex test" vengono eseguiti dal laboratorio, questi possono essere gestiti secondo le linee guida US/FHIR (vedi https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreport-guide.html) o altre politiche locali. Ad esempio, uno dei seguenti ...
1. Registrare i risultati addizionali dei reflex test come 'Risultati dei test' all'interno dello stesso 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result'.
2. 2. Registrare i risultati del reflex test come 'Risultati del test' all'interno di un nuovo 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result', ma fare riferimento alla richiesta originale del test di laboratorio tramite 'Dettagli della richiesta di test'.
3. 3. Registrare i risultati del reflex test come 'Risultati del test' all'interno di un nuovo 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result', ma fare riferimento alla nuova richiesta di test di laboratorio insieme alla richiesta originale di test di laboratorio tramite 'Dettagli della richiesta di test'.
it.misuse:
Da non utilizzare per registrare un'autopsia o un rapporto forense, anche se i test su alcuni campioni prelevati in tali situazioni possono essere rappresentati utilizzando questo archetipo. Per questi, saranno necessari archetipi aggiuntivi o specializzati per rappresentare i dati.

Questo archetipo √® adatto per la rappresentazione dei risultati generali dei test di laboratorio, ma non √® destinato a coprire i rapporti sinottici completi. Per questi, sono necessari ulteriori archetipi specializzati per rappresentare i dati.

In the State section of the archetype there is a simple 'Confounding factors' data element that is optional and can be repeated as one way to record a variety of simple factors that need to be made explicit as they may influence interpretation of the results. If the confounding factors are more complex, it may be appropriate to create a local/shared CLUSTER archetype that can be nested in the 'Confounding factors details' SLOT. 
Note 1: Known or required pre-conditions, such as 'fasting' or 'Day 1 of menstrual cycle', should be reported in the 'Sampling conditions' data element in the CLUSTER.specimen archetype, nested within this OBSERVATION archetype.
Note 2: Known issues with specimen collection or handling, such as 'sample haemolysed' or 'prolonged use of tourniquet' should be reported within 'Specimen quality' in the CLUSTER.specimen archetype, nested within this OBSERVATION archetype.

Where 'reflex tests' are performed by the laboratory, these may be handled as per US/FHIR guidance (see https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreport-guide.html) or other local policy. For example, one of the following ...
1. Record the reflex test results additional 'Test findings' within the same 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result'
2. Record the reflex test results as 'Test findings' within a new 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result' but refer to the original lab test request via 'Test request details'.
3. Record the reflex test results as 'Test findings' within a new 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result' but reference a new lab test request as well as the original lab test request via 'Test request details'.(en)

de.purpose: Zur Identifikation und Dokumentation von strukturierten Daten bez√ºglich einer bestimmten K√∂rperstelle oder innerhalb des menschlichen K√∂rpers, unter Verwendung makroskopischer anatomischer Fachbegriffe.

Dieser Archetyp wurde speziell f√ºr die Verwendung im Rahmen von allen geeigneten ENTRY- oder CLUSTER-Archetypen entwickelt, die den Kontext des anatomischen Fundortes liefern.

Als grundlegender Bestandteil der klinischen Praxis, k√∂nnen Mediziner anatomische Lokalisationen auf einer Vielzahl von komplexen und variablen Wegen definieren. In der Praxis tragen einige Archetypen ein einziges Datenelement f√ºr eine einfache Beschreibung der K√∂rperstelle - zum Beispiel OBSERVATION.blood_pressure und CLUSTER.symptom bei der Beschreibung von Ohrenschmerzen. In dieser Situation, in der die Wertemenge berechenbar und simpel zu definieren ist, ist dieses einzelne Datenelement eine sehr genaue und pragmatische M√∂glichkeit, die Stelle im K√∂rper zu protokollieren und zu einem sp√§teren Zeitpunkt abzufragen. In der Situation, in der die anatomische Lage nicht genau definiert ist oder zur Laufzeit bestimmt werden muss, kann es flexibler sein, diesen strukturierten Archetyp zu verwenden. Wenn zum Beispiel jedes Symptom ohne einen vordefinierten Umfang der Symptomatik aufgezeichnet werden kann, dann ist es sinnvoll, diesen Archetyp zu verwenden, um eine spezifische anatomische Lokalisation im K√∂rper zu definieren. CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative oder CLUSTER.anatomical_location_clock, falls dies ben√∂tigt wird. en.purpose: To identify and record structured details about a single physical site on, or within, the human body using macroscopic anatomical terms.
en.use:
Use to record structured and consistent details about a single identified physical site on, or within, the human body. 

This archetype is specifically designed to be used within the context of any appropriate ENTRY or CLUSTER archetypes which supply the context of the anatomical location. 

As a fundamental part of clinical practice, clinicians can describe anatomical locations in a myriad of complex and variable ways. In practice, some archetypes carry a single data element for carrying a simple description of body site - for example, OBSERVATION.blood_pressure and CLUSTER.symptom when describing ear pain. In this situation, where the value set is predictable and simple to define, this single data element is a very accurate and pragmatic way to record the site in the body and to query at a later date. However in the situation where the anatomical location is not well defined or needs to be determined at run-time, it may be more flexible to use this structured archetype. For example, in the situation where any symptom can be recorded without any predefined scope of the type of symptom, then allowing the use of this archetype to specifically define an anatomical location in the body may be useful. In this case the CLUSTER.symptom archetype also carries a SLOT for 'Detailed anatomical location' which can include this archetype to support maximal flexibility in recording anatomical location data.

This archetype supports recording complex structured anatomical sites. For example, the apex beat of the heart is typically found at the fifth left intercostal space in the mid-clavicular line, tenderness at McBurney's point on the abdominal wall or a laceration on the palmar aspect of the proximal right thumb.

A combination of the data elements in this archetype can be used to individually record each component of a postcoordinated terminology expression that represents the anatomical site.

The 'Alternative structure' SLOT allows inclusion of additional archetypes that provide an alternative structure for describing the same body site, such as CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative or CLUSTER.anatomical_location_clock, should this be required. In the situation where this archetype can only be used to name a large and/or non-specific body part, the additional use of the CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative archetype will support recording of a more precise location - for example, 2 cm anterior to the cubital fossa of the left forearm or 4 cm below R costal margin on the chest wall in the mid-clavicular line.

If this archetype is used within other archetypes where the specified subject of care is not the individual for whom the record is being created, for example a fetus in-utero, then the anatomical location will be identifying a body site on or within the fetus.
en.misuse: Not to be used for specifiying unilateral/bilateral occurrences of an anatomical feature.

sl.misuse: *Not for specifiying unilateral/bilateral occurence - this is related to an evaluation which perhaps includes multiple locations.(en)

en.purpose: To record the findings and interpretation of anatomical pathology tests performed on tissues, cells and body fluids.
en.use:
Use to record any anatomical pathology test result, including microscopic and macroscopic examinations of tissues, cells or body fluids. In some locations the terms "histopathology" and "cytology" may be used in place of "anatomical pathology".

This archetype is designed specifically to be used in the "Test result" SLOT within the OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result archetype, but may also be used within other ENTRY class archetypes where appropriate.

en.purpose: To record the result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual.
en.use:
Use to record the result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual. This is typically done in a laboratory, but may be done in other environments such as at the point of care.

This archetype is intended to cover the result of a single ordered investigation where the specimen(s) are collected as a single procedure, and may include multiple analyte results or other components. Examples of this could include 'Full blood count', which would yield a separate analyte result for the count of each type of blood cell, or 'kidney biopsy non-neoplastic', which would yield findings from microscopy, immunohistochemistry and electron microscopy.

This archetype has been designed to be a framework that will usually be extended with CLUSTER archetypes to enable appropriate recording of specific laboratory test result patterns. This includes, but is not limited to, tests for biochemistry, haematology, immunology and transfusion services etc and specific patterns for the unique requirements for microbiology and anatomical pathology. If the ordered tests or investigations do not commonly belong together in a named group or panel, each test result would normally be represented using separate instances of this archetype. There is, however, considerable variation in actual reporting/messaging practice and this archetype/related archetypes are designed to handle such variation.

This archetype supports multiple approaches to recording of specimen, reflecting current practice which varies enormously. A Laboratory test result has a high degree of alignment to an HL7 FHIR Diagnostic Report resource.

It is anticipated that one or more instances of this archetype, or archetype family, will be sent back to a requesting clinician within a laboratory report document comprising COMPOSITION.report_result archetype, or similar, and other relevant ENTRY archetypes.

The recording of confounding factors may be inconsistent, often depending on the analysing laboratory and on clinical information sent by the requester. In the State section of the archetype there is a simple 'Confounding factors' data element that is optional and can be repeated as one way to record a variety of simple factors that need to be made explicit as they may influence interpretation of the results. If the confounding factors are more complex, it may be appropriate to create a local/shared CLUSTER archetype that can be nested in the 'Confounding factors details' SLOT. 
Note 1: Known or required pre-conditions, such as 'fasting' or 'Day 1 of menstrual cycle', should be reported in the 'Sampling conditions' data element in the CLUSTER.specimen archetype, nested within this OBSERVATION archetype.
Note 2: Known issues with specimen collection or handling, such as 'sample haemolysed' or 'prolonged use of tourniquet' should be reported within 'Specimen quality' in the CLUSTER.specimen archetype, nested within this OBSERVATION archetype.

Where 'reflex tests' are performed by the laboratory, these may be handled as per US/FHIR guidance (see https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreport-guide.html) or other local policy. For example, one of the following ...
1. Record the reflex test results additional 'Test findings' within the same 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result'
2. Record the reflex test results as 'Test findings' within a new 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result' but refer to the original lab test request via 'Test request details'.
3. Record the reflex test results as 'Test findings' within a new 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result' but reference a new lab test request as well as the original lab test request via 'Test request details'.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record an Autopsy or a Forensic report, although tests on some specimens that are taken in such situations may be represented using this archetype. For these, additional or specialised archetypes will be required to represent the data.

This archetype is suitable for representation of general laboratory test results, but not intended to cover full synoptic reports. For these, additional specialising archetypes are required to represent the data.
